name: QuickBase
description: Add a QuickBase element to connect your existing QuickBase database, allowing you to manage data for your database tables. You will need your QuickBase database information to add an instance.

configuration.name: Subdomain
configuration.description: Subdomain is the domain against which you are invoking this call, for example, intuit.quickbase.com

configuration.name: Allow Select Fields parameter
configuration.description: Enables use of global fields query parameter to filter response to only specified fields. This will override any existing vendor functionality on the connector

configuration.name: Max Page Size (or limit)
configuration.description: Quickbase CRM Max Page Size (or limit)

configuration.name: QuickBase Objects
configuration.description: String of an array/map, like { objectName: databaseID }

configuration.name: QuickBase User ID
configuration.description: The ID of the current user. The user ID is required for some API calls. The userID persists from session to session

configuration.name: QuickBase Ticket
configuration.description: The authentication ticket needed for application access

configuration.name: Expires In
configuration.description: Session expiration window (12 hours normal - 43,200 seconds)

configuration.name: QuickBase User
configuration.description: The user’s email address registered with QuickBase or the user name that was selected within QuickBase when the user registered

configuration.name: Application Name
configuration.description: The QuickBase application/database name, (i.e. Test Database)

configuration.name: Application Token
configuration.description: The QuickBase application token. To find/generate Application tokens: go to Settings (for your app) > App properties > Advanced settings > Application Tokens (Security Options). Hit the link in "Go to the Manage Application Token page".

configuration.name: Filter null values from the response
configuration.description: Used to enable/disable filtering of null values from the responses.

configuration.name: Default select fields
configuration.description: Generic map used to specify default fields for bulk download and GET /all requests. Each key should be the canonical objectName and values may be specified as a comma-delimited string or a list of strings

configuration.name: Time of Getting Token or Performing Authentication
configuration.description: Quickbase CRM Time of Getting Token or Performing Authentication

configuration.name: Event poller refresh interval
configuration.description: Set time interval for polling application (in minutes)

configuration.name: Event Poller Resources Configuration
configuration.description: Event Poller Resources Configuration. The configuration is defined via JSON, an example of which is as follows - { "contacts": { "url": "/hubs/helpdesk/contacts", “idField”: “user.id”, “datesConfiguration”: { "updatedDateField": "user.updated_at", "updatedDateFormat": "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssX", “createdDateField”: “user.created_at”, “createdDateFormat": "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssX" }, "pageSize": 10000 } }

resources.description: Get a list of the names and dbids of all the applications and tables that you are entitled to access, across all domains

parameters.name: quickbase.ticket
parameters.description: The authentication ticket is returned via the API_Authenticate call

resources.description: Get information about the specified application or application table

parameters.name: quickbase.ticket
parameters.description: The authentication ticket is returned via the API_Authenticate call

resources.description: Find objects in the QuickBase system, using the provided object name and CEQL search expression. The search expression in CEQL is the WHERE clause in a typical SQL query, but without the WHERE keyword. If a search expression is not provided, then the first 200 records will be returned.

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The CEQL search expression, or the where clause, without the WHERE keyword, in a typical SQL query. The operators supported are '=', '!=', '>', '>=', '<', '<=', AND, OR. For example, a single query would be where=date_modified>='1475622798642'. A multiple query would be where=(date_modified<'1475622798642' or date_created>'1475622798640') and last_name='Henderson'. When this parameter is omitted, all objects of the given type are returned in a paginated fashion.

parameters.name: API_DoQuery
parameters.description: Functional action needed to do any querying

parameters.name: objectName
parameters.description: The object name of the object to search, e.g., 'account'.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The start page for pagination, which defaults to 1 if not supplied

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size for pagination, which defaults to 200 if not supplied

resources.description: Create a new object in the QuickBase  system. The provided objectName can be that of a custom or standard object. Object creation will flow through Cloud Elements to your DB service.

parameters.name: objectName
parameters.description: The object name of the object to be created, e.g., 'account'.

Object.description: Fields for the object. There will be fields associated with an Object, which are not all described here.

resources.description: Get a list of all the fields metadata for an object.

parameters.name: getAll
parameters.description: Use this parameter to retrieve all fields metadata for an object if true, or name/id if false. Defaults to true.

parameters.name: quickbase.ticket
parameters.description: The authentication ticket is returned via the API_Authenticate call

resources.description: Create a custom field for an object.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The fields object body. Useful parameters are label and type.

parameters.name: quickbase.ticket
parameters.description: The authentication ticket is returned via the API_Authenticate call

resources.description: Delete a field associated with a given object name from the QuickBase system.  Specifying an object associated with a given objectName and ID that does not exist will result in an error message.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the field to delete from the QuickBase system.

parameters.name: objectName
parameters.description: The object name of the object to be deleted, e.g., 'account'.

resources.description: Delete an object associated with a given object name and ID from the QuickBase system.  Specifying an object associated with a given objectName and ID that does not exist will result in an error message.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: The ID of the object to delete from the QuickBase system.

parameters.name: objectName
parameters.description: The object name of the object to be deleted, e.g., 'account'.

resources.description: Retrieve an object associated with a given ID from the QuickBase system. Specifying an object with a specified ID that does not exist will result in an error response.

parameters.name: objectName
parameters.description: The object name of the object to be retrieved, e.g., account'.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: The ID of the object to retrieve from the QuickBase system.

resources.description: Update an object associated with a given object name and ID in the QuickBase system. The update API uses the PATCH HTTP verb, so only those fields provided in the object will be updated, and those fields not provided will be left alone. Updating an object with a specified ID that does not exist will result in an error response.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The object with those fields that are to be updated.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: The ID of the object to update in the QuickBase system.

parameters.name: objectName
parameters.description: The object name of the object to be updated, e.g., 'account'.

resources.description: Create a file attachment for an given object name and ID in the QuickBase system. Creating an attachment for an object with a specified ID that does not exist will result in an error response.

parameters.name: multipart/form-data
parameters.description: The header to create base64 body

parameters.name: fieldName
parameters.description: The name of the field for the object name/id that the attachment is being posted to, (i.e. 'file', 'photo', etc).

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: The file to be uploaded to the QuickBase system

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: The ID of the object to update in the QuickBase system.

parameters.name: objectName
parameters.description: The object name of the object to be updated, e.g., 'account'.

resources.description: Download a file attachment using the associated field ID for an given object name and ID in the QuickBase system. Creating an attachment for an object with a specified ID or field ID that does not exist will result in an error response.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: The ID of the object to update in the QuickBase system.

parameters.name: Version Number
parameters.description: Version number is used to specify the version of the file. The default is set at 0, the most recent version.

parameters.name: objectName
parameters.description: The object name of the object to be updated, e.g., 'account'.

parameters.name: fieldId
parameters.description: The ID of the field for the object name/id that the attachment is being posted to, (i.e. 'file', 'photo', etc). This can be retrieved using a GET /{objectName}/fields call or via the QuickBase UI

parameters.name: true
parameters.description: Turns on streaming for this API

resources.description: Get a list of all the available objects.
Get a list of all the field for an object.

parameters.name: quickbase.ticket
parameters.description: The authentication ticket is returned via the API_Authenticate call
